intro: Tephrosia langlassei, commonly known as the African velvet tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or white in color. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets. Tephrosia langlassei is often found in open woodlands and savannas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
